source:
<!--
  ## Introduction

  Use [`amp-twitter`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-twitter-v0.1.md) to embed tweets into your AMP HTML files.
--><!-- -->
<!doctype html>
<html ⚡>
<head>
<meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>amp-twitter</title>
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <!-- ## Setup -->
  <!-- Don't forget to import the twitter component -->
  <script async custom-element="amp-twitter" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-twitter-0.1.js"></script>
  <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-twitter/index.html">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
</head>
<body>

  <!-- ## Basic usage -->
  <!-- Tweets are embedded via id. Twitter does not currently provide an API that yields fixed aspect ratio Tweet embeds.
    You may need to manually tweak the provided width and height.
-->
  <amp-twitter width="375" height="472" layout="responsive" data-tweetid="638793490521001985">
  </amp-twitter>

  <!-- ## Hidden cards -->
  <!--
    Options for the Tweet appearance can be set using `data-` attributes, for example `data-cards="hidden"` deactivates Twitter cards.
  -->
  <amp-twitter width="390" height="330" layout="responsive" data-tweetid="585110598171631616" data-cards="hidden">
  </amp-twitter>

  <!-- ## Twitter moment embed -->
    <!-- Use `data-momentid` to include a twitter moment. -->
    <amp-twitter width="390" height="330" layout="responsive" data-momentid="1018806709412876288">
</amp-twitter>
</body></html>

sections.doc_:
## Introduction

Use [`amp-twitter`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-twitter-v0.1.md) to embed tweets into your AMP HTML files.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

Use amp-twitter to embed tweets into your AMP HTML files.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

Use [`amp-twitter`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-twitter-v0.1.md) to embed tweets into your AMP HTML files.

sections.doc_: Don't forget to import the twitter component
sections.normalizedDoc_: Don't forget to import the twitter component

<link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-twitter/index.html">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_:
Tweets are embedded via id. Twitter does not currently provide an API that yields fixed aspect ratio Tweet embeds.

You may need to manually tweak the provided width and height.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
Tweets are embedded via id. Twitter does not currently provide an API that yields fixed aspect ratio Tweet embeds.
 You may need to manually tweak the provided width and height.

sections.doc_: Options for the Tweet appearance can be set using `data-` attributes, for example `data-cards="hidden"` deactivates Twitter cards.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Options for the Tweet appearance can be set using `data-` attributes, for example `data-cards="hidden"` deactivates Twitter cards.

sections.doc_: Use `data-momentid` to include a twitter moment.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use `data-momentid` to include a twitter moment.
